page.title: 14TRANSPORT THROUGH CROSSGATES
page.content:
Near the Arndale Centre is{Crossgates {railway station.}The line is a very old one, the first one being built in 1834. The railway line was originally built to link Leeds with the port of Hull via Selby to facilitate the transport of goods to the new and growing industrial town of Leeds. Nowadays the station is useful for office workers and other{commuters}who travel daily to the centre of Leeds.
The main road from Leeds to Selby is even older than the railway. This road, the{A63,}runs straight up the hill through Whitkirk _ the railway goes round the hill through Crossgates _ and years ago was a{toll {road.}Nowadays it is still a busy road, but much of the heavy traffic heading for Hull uses the M62 instead.
